result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Marvin Kutz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant David Marvin Kutz in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed in 15 CF 233, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads guilty to Ct. 5 in 15 CF 233, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 1, Ct. 2, Ct. 3, Ct. 4, Ct. 6, Ct. 7, Ct. 8, Ct. 9, Ct. 10, and Ct. 11 in 15 CF 233, 15 CM 177, 15 CM 255, 15 CT 29 dismissed, read in, 15 FO 110 dismissed, Court withholds sentence, probation 3 years, $528.00 costs, $550.00 and $1,155.00 Restitution to be paid within first 18 months of probation, submit DNA Sample, defendant to report to probation and parole by Noon tomorrow 9/29/15, cash bond to be applied
plea/sentencing hearing on September 28, 2015 at 2:45 p.m.

Attorney Robert Franklin Nagel appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called: 15CM177, 15CM255, & 15CT29.  Signed bond filed in 15CM255 by atty Nagel.  Offer has been made.  Defendant needs more time pay the restituition and get a valid DL.  Atty Nagel requested matter be set for trial.  Defendant stands mute on all charges by atty Nagel.  Not guilty pleas entered by court.  Matters will be set for trial.  Bond remains.
Authorization to Appear and Act filed by Atty. Robert Nagel - fax - original received 6/10/15 -ks

Attorney Robert Franklin Nagel appeared for defendant w/Authorization. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading of complaint, $2,000.00 sign bond, signed bond to be returned w/in 1 week  Return date scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
